hero.heading: Energy Efficiency
hero.copy: Energy efficiency matters if you’re looking to save money on bills or maximize the comfort of your home.
hero.direction: Here are terms to remember while you shop

inspiration.heading: Triple pane & low-E glass
copy: Triple pane glass can be filled with gas that makes it hard for heat and humidity to pass through, which helps you cut your energy costs. Low-E glass has an invisible metallic coating that keeps heat inside during winter and outside during summer. Both types of glass will help cut your energy costs.

inspiration.heading: UV coating fade protection
copy: Vinyl patio doors are always UV-coated to protect against fading. You can also get UV-coated glass that acts like sunscreen for furniture inside your home.

inspiration.heading: U-factor & Solar Heat Gain Coefficient (SHGC)
copy: The lower the U-factor, the less heat and cold can transfer through the door. A lower SHGC means there are fewer UV rays passing through the glass. They’re both helpful factors in finding doors that meet ENERGY STAR® requirements for your region.

inspiration.heading: Screens
copy: To take advantage of great weather and save on heat or air, a screen will allow you to open your patio door while keeping bugs out.

small.alt: Jeld-Wen V-2500 Vinyl Sliding Patio Door Pet Door

next.heading: Now, let’s talk about your patio door’s durability.
next.copy: From hurricane debris to the decibels of a passing airplane, there are ways to measure what can get through your door.
